[bq="uc9"]"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559773be636872687e000cb3#post_559773be636872687e000cb3
Or you could legalize it and require that businesses that create the drugs the employees have to have background checks and all be squeeky clean, regular police inspections often and that if any guns are found on the premises they lose their license and that sellers and distributors have to have medical licenses to do so?  Also have a semi-high tax rate that directly goes to rehab clinics; to give a equivalent semi-high tax alcohol and the money generated from those taxes goes to alcohol rehab.[/bq]
>legalized

Then all the sacrifice to defeat the cartels was in vain.
Fuck that.[/bq]
It worked for Portugal.[/bq]
I doubt that will stop the violence

topics.body:
So the Nichijou manga is getting released in NA with an English translation, that's all fine and dandy but apparently other than that (and Australia getting subbed DVDs), Finland got a translation of the manga starting back in 2012.

"FINLAND.":http://tokio.fi/manga/arki

_AND NOWHERE ELSE._ Until now anyways.

We have here in the Philippines something called the Sin Tax Bill. It basically adds tax to Cigars and Cigarettes to discourage them from common public use. Drugs are still illegal of course. We don't want that poison in our homes.
